info.title: Hevy API Docs
info.description:
Welcome to Hevy's new public API! We're just starting to roll this out and depending
      on your feedback, we'll be adding more features and endpoints. Also, we make no guarantees
      that we won't completely change the structure or abandon the project entirely so use it at
      your own risk. Currently, this API is only available to Hevy Pro users. You can get your 
      key on our web app at https://hevy.com/settings?developer. If you have any questions,
      please reach out to desmond@hevyapp.com ü§ù.

get.summary: Get a paginated list of workouts

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of items on the requested page (Max 10)

get.summary: Get the total number of workouts on the account

Retrieve a paged list of workout events (updates or deletes) since a given date. Events are ordered from newest to oldest. The intention is to allow clients to keep their local cache of workouts up to date without having to fetch the entire list of workouts.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of items on the requested page (Max 10)

get.description: Returns a paginated array of workout events, indicating updates or deletions.

200.description: A paginated list of workout events

get.summary: Get a single workout‚Äôs complete details by the workoutId
Get a paginated list of routines

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of items on the requested page (Max 10)

404.description: Routine doesn't exist or doesn't belong to the user

get.summary: Get a paginated list of exercise templates available on the account.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of items on the requested page (Max 100)

200.description: A paginated list of exercise templates

get.summary: Get a single exercise template by id.

parameters.name: exerciseTemplateId
parameters.description: The id of the exercise template

get.summary: Get a paginated list of routine folders available on the account.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of items on the requested page (Max 10)

200.description: A paginated list of routine folders

post.summary: Create a new routine folder. The folder will be created at index 0, and all other folders will have their indexes incremented.

201.description: The routine folder was successfully created

get.summary: Get a single routine folder by id.

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: The id of the routine folder

exercise_template_id.description: The ID of the exercise template.

notes.example: Felt good today. Form was on point.

description.description: A description for the workout workout.
description.example: Medium intensity leg day focusing on quads.

is_private.description: A boolean indicating if the workout is private.

exercise_template_id.description: The ID of the exercise template.

folder_id.description: The folder id the routine should be added to. Pass null to insert the routine into default "My Routines" folder

notes.example: Focus on form over weight. Remember to stretch.

exercise_template_id.description: The ID of the exercise template.

title.description: The title of the routine folder.

primary_muscle_group.description: The primary muscle group of the exercise.

secondary_muscle_groups.description: The secondary muscle groups of the exercise.

is_custom.description: A boolean indicating whether the exercise is a custom exercise.

index.description: The routine folder index. Describes the order of the folder in the list.

updated_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the folder was last updated.

created_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the folder was created.

updated_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the routine was last updated.

created_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the routine was created.

index.description: Index indicating the order of the exercise in the routine.

notes.example: Focus on form. Go down to 90 degrees.

exercise_template_id.description: The id of the exercise template. This can be used to fetch the exercise template.

supersets_id.description: The id of the superset that the exercise belongs to. A value of null indicates the exercise is not part of a superset.

index.description: Index indicating the order of the set in the routine.

set_type.description: The type of set. This can be one of 'normal', 'warmup', 'dropset', 'failure'

reps.description: Number of reps logged for the set

distance_meters.description: Number of meters logged for the set

duration_seconds.description: Number of seconds logged for the set

rpe.description: RPE (Relative perceived exertion) value logged for the set

description.example: Pushed myself to the limit today!

start_time.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the workout was recorded to have started.

end_time.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the workout was recorded to have ended.

updated_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the workout was last updated.

created_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the workout was created.

index.description: Index indicating the order of the exercise in the workout.

notes.example: Paid closer attention to form today. Felt great!

exercise_template_id.description: The id of the exercise template. This can be used to fetch the exercise template.

supersets_id.description: The id of the superset that the exercise belongs to. A value of null indicates the exercise is not part of a superset.

index.description: Index indicating the order of the set in the workout.

set_type.description: The type of set. This can be one of 'normal', 'warmup', 'dropset', 'failure'

reps.description: Number of reps logged for the set

distance_meters.description: Number of meters logged for the set

duration_seconds.description: Number of seconds logged for the set

rpe.description: RPE (Relative perceived exertion) value logged for the set

type.description: Indicates the type of the event (updated)
Indicates the type of the event (deleted)

id.description: The unique identifier of the deleted workout

deleted_at.description: A date string indicating when the workout was deleted

page_count.description: The total number of pages available

events.description: An array of workout events (either updated or deleted)
